body.name: TCL 55 Class 55S403 (54.6 Diag.) 4K Ultra HD Roku LED LCD TV
body.stockDetail: Only 2 left in stock - order soon.
features: High Dynamic Range (HDR) Technology 4K Creative Pro upscaling engine
120Hz CMI effective refresh rate Dual-band Wi-Fi & Ethernet port
Stream 450,000 movies & TV episodes across 4,000 streaming channels

AV Input Composite Video + L&R Audio In Audio Output (RCA) No VGA No RF Input (NTSC, ATSC) 1 Ethernet (10/100/1000Mbps) 1 USB 1 USB2.0 HDMI 3 HDMI 2.0 w/HDCP 2.2 (1 ARC) SPDIF Digital Audio Optical 1 Audio Output Headphone 1 YPbPr (Component Video) Input No
body.description: The TCL 55" Class 4K (2160P) Roku Smart LED TV (55S403) delivers stunning Ultra HD picture quality with four times the resolution of Full HD for enhanced clarity and detail, as well as the most streaming channels of any 4K TV. To make the most of all this content, high dynamic range (HDR) technology delivers bright and accurate colors for a lifelike viewing experience. In addition, your favorite HD shows, movies, and sporting events are upscaled to near Ultra HD resolution with 4K Upscaling. The simple, intuitive interface allows seamless access to over 500,000 streaming movies and TV episodes, your cable box, Blu-ray player, gaming console, and other devices without flipping through inputs or complicated menus.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars VERY VERY Happy with this TV!!!
reviews.reviewText: Just plain awesome. I was scared to purchase this TV because at the time I did, there were zero reviews. I found it odd that this model was cheaper then the TCL 2017 “55 inch for $100 more sold by another seller on Amazon. So I compared both TVs on another site stats wise and found both were exactly the same. I took a chance and saved $. TV arrived in three days. Box was in perfect condition along with Television. Quality of screen 10. Sound 10. Plays my ps4 pro like a boss. TV is super light for it’s size. Came with one remote with easy controls. I added LED lights to the back of mine and damn it looks good. No weird spots or shadows on screen like some reviews had reported on other size TCL’s. I’m adding a sound bar soon but not because it needs it. I hadn’t heard of TCL before but I’m VERY happy with my purchase and plan on buying two more soon.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Quit working at 7 months!
reviews.reviewText: TV Quit working after 7 months. That is with an adult using it the typical few hours after work and some weekend use. I'm Not a big TV user here so there is no reason for it to stop working so soon!Warranty is only 90 days. I paid almost 600$ for the tv it's not like I had bought a cheap couple hundred dollar tv. Beware of this product

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great TV, Died under 2 years!!
reviews.reviewText: Buyer beware:After doing a lot of research and being a very tech savvy person (however with minimal budget for things I'd really like!) I was so pumped to find this TV. Not only did it great great reviews from 3rd party individuals, shows, blogs webcasts etc, but everyone was always blown away by the picture at this price! I completely agreed. Having 4K, HDR and a 55-inch TV in my living room that was beautiful for this price was absolutely incredible. No serious complaints that would outweigh the value for money here on the WORKING TV.However beware. Perhaps why it is able to be so inexpensive.. The picture on my TV has cut out approximately 1.5 years after purchase... That is not the life span of a TV you invest in. Not even close. Surprise, surprise the limited warranty is 1 year. When buying a TV I am putting in that much research and time to consider the value and the quality. It is a fair chunk of money and I want to make sure I'm happy with the product for what is assumed to be a number or years AT LEAST. Obviously after searching online it was not hard to see that I was not alone and many people, youtubers and even sites sell replacement boards etc, as it is a known issue. I suppose to some extent that is the risk you take when going with a brand that is new and "upcoming and getting stronger in the market" (as reviewers said - one of the reasons I felt comforted in the brand being new).It's a great TV but just be careful. Sometimes that cost-quality ratio can get you a lemon and that lemon can be end up being the same price as buying a MUCH more expensive TV from the start...
